intro: Calochortus palmeri var. dunnii, commonly known as the Dunn's mariposa lily, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the genus Calochortus, which includes a variety of flowering plants known for their showy, often showy, cup-shaped blooms. This particular variety is characterized by its pale to medium pink flowers, which are typically borne on slender, upright stems. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It is adapted to arid environments and is an important component of local flora in its native range.
